question.body: In addition to meninges, fluid-filled spaces help protect the brain nervous tissue. The subarachnoid space would be found between which two meninges?

response.feedback: Incorrect. There is another layer between these two.
Incorrect. This would be a subdural space.
Correct. The pia mater is internal, directly against the nervous tissue without a space and subarachnoid means it is below the arachnoid mater.

part.hint: Think of the order of meninges from outer to inner and review the meaning of “sub-“ as a prefix.

question.body: Which of the following gray or white matter brain structures is correctly paired with its description?

multiple_choice.choice: stellate cells: connect different parts within the same hemisphere
projection tracts: receive sensory input and process information locally
commissural tracts: connects right and left hemisphere
association tracts: cells with unmyelinated connections within part of the CNS
neocortex: tracts extending from higher to lower regions of the brain

response.feedback: Incorrect. Gray matter stellate cells would be in gray matter and white matter tracts would connect different parts in the brain.
Incorrect. White matter projection tracts would connect different parts in the brain and neurons in gray matter would have to receive and process information.
Correct. The large white matter corpus callosum is the main connection between two cerebral hemispheres, but there are also others.
Incorrect. Association tracts would be white matter within a hemisphere while gray matter pyramidal cells would extend to different parts of CNS.
Incorrect. The brain cortex would be gray matter with cells while white matter projection tracts would extend from higher to lower regions of the brain.

part.hint: The gray matter will include neuron cell bodies with synapses to other cells while the white matter appears white because it is made up of mainly myelinated neuron axons connecting different parts within the brain or between brain and spinal cord.
